intro: Senecio wolfii, commonly known as the Wolf's Senecio, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and fibrous root system. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters, featuring narrow, hairy leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
